meanings.definition: The quality or state of being basic.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the basicities of math is crucial for solving problems.
meanings.sent2: She explained the basicities of cooking to the new chef.
meanings.sent3: The basicities of the situation were so clear that even a child could see them.
meanings.sent4: His speech stripped away the complex layers, revealing only the basicities of the issue.
meanings.sent5: The basicities of grammar are like the building blocks of language.

meanings.definition: The basic nature or essence of something.
meanings.sent1: The basicities of the story were easy to understand.
meanings.sent2: She captured the basicities of the character in her painting.
meanings.sent3: The basicities of the joke made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: In the chaos, he found solace in the basicities of nature.
meanings.sent5: The basicities of friendship lie in trust and understanding.
